OmeroScreen Plots
  • Combined Plot API
  • Edit on GitHub

Combined Plot API

The combined plot creates comprehensive visualizations with marginal distributions for exploring relationships between features with integrated histogram and scatter plot components.

Main Functions

omero_screen_plots.comb_plot(df: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], feature_col: str, feature_y_lim: float, condition_col: str = 'condition', selector_col: str | None = 'cell_line', selector_val: str | None = None, title: str | None = None, cell_number: int | None = None, colors: list[str] = ['#526C94', '#D8C367', '#75B1CE', '#DC6B83', '#D4D3CF', '#00bfb2', '#CCDBA2', '#889466', '#C6B2D1', '#654875'], fig_size: tuple[float, float] = (10, 7), size_units: str = 'cm', save: bool = True, path: Path | None = None) → None[source]

Plot a combined histogram and scatter plot.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – pd.DataFrame containing the data to plot.

  • conditions (list[str]) – list[str] containing the conditions to plot.

  • feature_col (str) – str containing the column to plot.

  • feature_y_lim (float) – float containing the threshold for color categorization.

  • condition_col (str) – str containing the column indicating experimental condition.

  • selector_col (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the column indicating the cell line.

  • df – pd.DataFrame containing the data to plot.

  • conditions – list[str] containing the conditions to plot.

  • feature_col – str containing the column to plot.

  • feature_y_lim – float containing the threshold for color categorization.

  • condition_col – str containing the column indicating experimental condition.

  • selector_col – Optional[str] containing the column indicating the cell line.

  • selector_val (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the value of the cell line to plot.

  • title (str | None) – str | None containing the title of the plot.

  • cell_number (int | None) – int | None containing the number of cells to plot.

  • colors (list[str]) – list[str] containing the colors to use for the plot.

  • fig_size (tuple[float, float]) – tuple[float, float] containing the size of the figure.

  • size_units (str) – str containing the units of the figure size.

  • save (bool) – bool containing whether to save the plot.

  • path (Path | None) – Path | None containing the path to save the plot.

Return type:

None

Examples

Basic Combined Analysis

Create a combined scatter plot with marginal histograms:

from omero_screen_plots import comb_plot
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
fig = comb_plot(
    df=df,
    x_feature="area_cell",
    y_feature="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    conditions=['control', 'cond01', 'cond02', 'cond03'],
    condition_col="condition",
    selector_col="cell_line",
    selector_val="MCF10A",
    plot_type="scatter",
    title="Combined Feature Analysis",
    save=True,
    file_format="svg"
)

Cell Cycle Combination

Combine cell cycle scatter plot with DNA content and EdU marginal distributions:

fig = comb_plot(
    df=df,
    x_feature="integrated_int_DAPI_norm",
    y_feature="intensity_mean_EdU_nucleus_norm",
    conditions=['control', 'treatment'],
    condition_col="condition",
    selector_col="cell_line",
    selector_val="MCF10A",
    plot_type="scatter",
    title="Cell Cycle Combined Analysis"
)
